summary: Solutions-focused, versatile management professional with a 30-year U.S. Marine Corps career, adept at leading teams, doctrine/publication development, and complex operational support. Demonstrates strong verbal and written communication, organizational prowess, and security clearance experience, with extensive field and training leadership across MEU/SOC deployments.

experience.title: Consultant
experience.description: Part-time consultant assisting doctrine writers revising doctrine, tactics, techniques and procedures manuals, including ATP 3-09.13 (FM 3-09.13) and related Fire Support topics; supported Battlefield Coordination Detachment (BCD) and Army Doctrine 2015 format.

experience.title: Primary Doctrine Writer
experience.description: Primary Doctrine Writer for Explosive Hazard Operations, ATP 3-34.20/MCRP 3-17.2D; authored and updated doctrinal publications; re-wrote FM 3-34.210; gathered and analyzed information for publication updates.

experience.title: Military Analyst
experience.description: Capability Gap Analysis, DOTMPLF assessments, and related research in support of DCIED; extensive knowledge of Defeat the Device and related ISR/DT solutions; JUONS and DtD liaison and material solution research.

experience.title: Associate
experience.description: Performing capability gap analyses, DOTMPLF assessments, and research; authored/co-authored CONOPS and TTPs; supported material solution research for warfighters.

experience.title: Associate
experience.description: Training & Doctrine Developer for MSCoE MDoT; contributed to Site Exploitation doctrine; identified and researched exploitation concepts; supported site exploitation doctrine development.

experience.title: Lead Instructor
experience.description: Instructor for Combat and Advanced Search; trained Marines and Army personnel in search techniques across Iraq and Enduring Freedom; taught multiple search domains.

experience.title: Senior Enlisted Leader
experience.description: Mentored over 6,000 Marines and Sailors; supervised training of rotary wing squadrons; ensured up-to-date tactics and protective services operations; oversaw humanitarian relief planning and execution.

experience.title: Command Sergeant Major
experience.company: 15th Marine Expeditionary Unit (SOC) / First MEU, Camp Pendleton, CA
experience.description: Senior Enlisted Leader for MEU (SOC); mentored 2,800+ Marines and Sailors; developed TTPs for CIED; planned and executed combat deployments; directed relief operations in Anbar; liaison between ARG and MEU (SOC).

education.degree: Master of Arts in Business Organizational Security Management
Bachelor of Science in General Studies Psychology

certifications: Marine Air Ground Task Force Intelligence Course
